intro: Psychotria guineensis, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a waxy texture. Psychotria guineensis is also notable for containing psychoactive alkaloids, which have been studied for their potential medicinal and hallucinogenic properties.
